wikipedia_page.main: Frederick "Fred" Harris (birth unknown – death unknown) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s and 1940s. He played at representative level for Great Britain (non-Test matches), England, English League XIII and Lancashire, and at club level for Leigh (Heritage № 345), and Leeds, as a wing, or centre, i.e. number 2 or 5, or 3 or 4.

response: * Fred Harris (presenter) (fl. 1970s–present), British comedian and television presenter
* Fred Harris (lawyer) (1910–1979), American politician, judge and painter
* Fred Harris (British politician) (1915–1979), British businessman and politician
* Fred Harris (footballer, born 1912) (1912–1998), English footballer for Birmingham City
* Fred Harris (rugby league) (fl. 1930s–1940s), English rugby league footballer for England, Leigh, and Leeds
* Fred Harris (Australian footballer) (1937–2019), Australian rules footballer
